intro: Anthistiria latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf anthistiria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported calming and digestive properties.
